author: Special Correspondent
text:
A volleyball match between Alagappa University and Annamalai University teams under way in Ramanathapuram on Thursday.— Photo: L. Balachandar

The Tamil Nadu State level Inter-University competition got off to a colourful start with 347 players, including 160 women, presenting an impressive march past at Syed Ammal Engineering College near here on Thursday.

A. Anwar Raja, MP, inaugurated the competition, conducted by the district unit of the Sports Development Authority of Tamil Nadu (SDAT), which offers a total prize money of Rs. 12.15 lakh.

In his address, Mr. Raja said that sportspersons were highly respected in the country and they had a bright future if they represented the State in national-level events and the country in international-level events. While Sachin Tendulkar was nominated to the Rajya Sabha, other sports personalities were given prestigious posts by several organisations and public sector undertakings, he said.

The SDAT spent Rs. 10 crore every year to promote sports activities and identify hidden talents in the State, he said adding the government also provided reservation for sportspersons in admission to professional courses and jobs in public sector undertakings.

K. Xavier Jothisargunam, District Sports and Youth Welfare Officer, said that players from eight universities would vie for honours in volleyball, tennis, table tennis and badminton in the three-day competition. The players represented Bharathiyar, Anna, Annamalai, SRM, Hindustan, Madurai Kamaraj, Madras and Alagappa universities, he said.

Every winner, both in team and individual events, would be awarded a cash prize of Rs. 10,000 each, he said.

The first runner-up would get Rs. 7,500 each and the second runner-up Rs 5,000 each. The players would clash for singles and doubles titles in tennis and table tennis, he said.

Volleyball and table tennis matches were held at Syed Ammal Engineering College while tennis and badminton at the synthetic court and indoor stadium at Seethakathi Sethupathy Sport Stadium in the town, he said.
title: Inter-varsity contest begins
